results.headline: Review: In ‘Starless Dreams,’ the Young, Female and Detained in Tehran
results.summary_short: This documentary, by Mehrdad Oskouei, depicts a female juvenile detention center in Tehran that offers a benign contrast to its residents’ outside lives.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Starless Dreams

results.headline: Review: ‘My Father Die,’ Full of Testosterone and Misogyny
results.summary_short: One of the hallmarks of this film, by Sean Brosnan, is the disjunction of the gorgeous and the gag-inducing as father and son try to kill each other.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of My Father Die

results.headline: Review: In ‘Antarctica: Ice and Sky,’ a Scientist’s Life Work
results.summary_short: After more than 60 years exploring the bottom of the world, Claude Lorius is a student of snow, a decoder of ice and a voice on climate change.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Antarctica: Ice and Sky

results.headline: Review: ‘The Founder,’ the Story of a Supersize Businessman
results.summary_short: Mr. Keaton’s kinetic performance as the man who made McDonald’s what it is today doesn’t enhance the movie; it is the movie.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Founder

results.display_title: Leonard Cohen: Bird on a Wire
results.headline: Review: ‘Leonard Cohen: Bird on a Wire,’ Portrait of an Artist in Chaos
results.summary_short: Tony Palmer’s documentary follows this singer-songwriter in an early phase of his career, during a somewhat disordered 1972 European tour.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Leonard Cohen: Bird on a Wire

results.headline: Review: Madonna Said ‘Strike a Pose,’ and It Was Life-Altering
results.summary_short: This documentary looks at the dancers from that singer’s film “Truth or Dare” and its influence on gay rights and awareness.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Strike a Pose

results.headline: Review: ‘Sleepless,’ but No Need to Reach for the Sominex
results.summary_short: This entry in the dad-to-the-rescue action-movie genre doesn’t have enough twists to even tie a shoelace.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Sleepless

results.display_title: Vince Giordano: There's a Future in the Past
results.headline: Review: ‘Vince Giordano,’ a Nostalgist With Fresh Takes on Jazz
results.summary_short: This documentary profiles a passionate preservationist and bandleader whose devotion to stylistic authenticity infuses his band’s peppy and carefree performances.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Vince Giordano: There's a Future in the Past

results.headline: Review: Horses Under the Hood? In ‘Monster Trucks,’ Try a Cephalopod
results.summary_short: A small-town teenager and a creature released by a geyser are unlikely friends in this live-action eco-fable from the “Ice Age” director Chris Wedge.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Monster Trucks

results.headline: Review: ‘Reset’ Follows Benjamin Millepied’s Efforts to Rejuvenate Paris Opera Ballet
results.summary_short: The job didn’t work out in the end, but this riveting film documents a choreographer’s cheerfully tenacious effort as well as his work on one ballet.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Reset

results.headline: Review: ‘The Son of Joseph’ Fancifully Repackages the Nativity
results.summary_short: Eugène Green’s new movie is divided into five sections, each titled after a biblical episode.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Son of Joseph

results.headline: Review: A Husband Vanishes in ‘Claire in Motion.’ Mysteries Multiply.
results.summary_short: In this film, the latest written and directed by Lisa Robinson and Annie J. Howell, a wife searches for clues and finds larger unanswered questions.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Claire in Motion

results.headline: Review: An Act of Rebellion, Blandly Told in ‘Alone in Berlin’
results.summary_short: A German couple who lose their son in World War II embark on a campaign of micro-resistance.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Alone in Berlin

results.headline: Review: ‘Bad Kids of Crestview Academy’ Brings Blood to Detention
results.summary_short: Prep-school students in Saturday detention are trapped on campus to die one by one in this film directed by Ben Browder, a sequel to “Bad Kids Go to Hell.”

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Bad Kids of Crestview Academy

results.headline: Review: ‘The Bye Bye Man,’ Oddly Overstaying His Welcome
results.summary_short: This movie melds the summon-the-evil-by-its-name convention with the old try-not-to-think-of-an-elephant mind game, with scary results.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Bye Bye Man

results.headline: Review: The Virgin Mary Takes a Surreal Detour in ‘MA’
results.summary_short: Best enjoyed as a slide show of visual blessings and, sometimes, bafflements, this film is a showcase for Celia Rowlson-Hall, its director, writer and star.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of MA

results.headline: Review: ‘100 Streets,’ Where an Ex-Jock, a Cabby and a Thug Struggle
results.summary_short: Idris Elba is among the stars of this Jim O’Hanlon film, a converging-narratives movie set in London.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of 100 Streets

results.headline: Review: ‘Everybody Knows ... Elizabeth Murray’ and Now You Will Too
results.summary_short: The movie shows the great variety of Murray’s always vivid, colorful work, and culminates with a retrospective at the Museum of Modern Art.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Everybody Knows ... Elizabeth Murray

results.headline: Review: ‘One Piece Film: Gold,’ a Frantic Hunt for Pirate Loot
results.summary_short: This entry in the “One Piece” anime franchise involves the liberation of gamblers on a floating casino complex.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of One Piece Film: Gold

results.headline: Review: ‘Underworld: Blood Wars,’ Bathed in Blue and Partied Out
results.summary_short: This action-horror franchise about warring vampires and werewolves returns for a fifth outing. But is it a sequel or a dissertation?

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Underworld: Blood Wars
